page.title: 14John Clare (poet)
page.content: John Clare was a poet who lived in Helpston many years ago.He came from a poor background but got a little education in the church porch at Glinton.There is still evidence of this as he inscribed his name on the wall. John Clare worked on a farm.The farm was owned by the Jones family.While John was working on the farm he fell in love with Mr. Jones's daughter Mary.But he was not considered a suitable match for her because of his earlier life. Later John started to write poetry.Most of his poems were discriptions and rural matters.In 1837 he went insane and was sent to an asylum where he died in 1864.
